We shouldn't let a day go by without mentioning the Walleys Landfill site run by @RedIndustries2 that's poisoning the residents of Staffordshire with dangerous hydrogen sulphide fumes, making their daily lives hell. #healthemergency
@EnvAgency @MattHancock @guardian @Independent https://t.co/p5smCkqLAi

Putrid stench from @RedIndustries2 #WalleysQuarry at my daughter's nursery in the Westlands this morning. Another day at work worrying about what she's breathing in üò° how's that emissions data coming on @EnvAgencyMids @ClareDinnisEA @JamesBevanEA?? #stopthestink

urls.title: What are the implications of climate change on military operations and how must engineering adapt? online
urls.description: ICE and InstRE Joint Professional Meeting: Presentations will explore the new challenges faced by the engineering profession, as a result of climate change.

tweets.text:
What are the implications of climate change on military operations and how must engineering adapt?

That is the question we will be asking in this year's joint professional meeting with @ICE_engineers.

Join us online, 17 June from 09:00. Book now: https://t.co/3W5ZMjzdnL https://t.co/oGPX1O8abL

#BREAKING:

@thameswater fined ¬£4m after 79m litres of sewage sludge flooded a park and the #HogsmillRiver #chalkstream in south-west London. 

Photos show the sludge and debris carried along in the #pollution.

This is a breaking news story... More to come...
#NewMalden https://t.co/LKWTCcyC2K

@JuliaBradbury @Jon19861 @WalleysL @RedIndustries2 @EnvAgency I live less than half a mile away. No option to move even though I think vof it daily. Mental health is on the rise at a rapid rate, many suffering with breathing issues. Its inhumane and down right cruelty to let us continually suffer on a daily basis.
Enough is enough.

tweets.text: This is part of the reason the wharfe is a shadow of its former self. Yet the @EnvAgency claim it is ecologically good in fact too good to be true. Just more spin on a river slowly dying. https://t.co/gmR5OV2Acw

Wild fish and their waters need your help. We have launched a Parliamentary Petition to give @EnvAgency the funds and freedom they need to protect English rivers. Please sign and share our petition to give rivers a fighting chance. #standingupforrivers
https://t.co/oxNkHEqHQL https://t.co/0sZJF68qs8

tweets.text:
üå≥NEW BLOGüå≥

Looking at the joint report 'Why society needs nature: Lessons from research during Covid-19' from
@EnvAgency, @NaturalEngland, @NatResWales, @nature_scot & @Forest_Research.

https://t.co/DfTgdg9eGy

#MakeSpaceForNature #BetterWithNature #PeopleAndNature #Wellbeing https://t.co/IQ11ntaD3d
Ummm I thought they had ‚Äúfinished work‚Äù in cell 1 @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgency @StinkStopthe @AaronBell4NUL @SimonTagg #StopTheStink https://t.co/erH4ZRhgEA

@CavernamVenenum @EnvAgencyMids But surely the govt. could just step in and compulsory purchase order the land. I assume that is just considered too expensive (since they would then also have to pay for clean up, with or without a fine). With enough funding though, this can surely be fixed?

@CavernamVenenum @EnvAgencyMids My guess: cost + legal and admin barriers. I assume the EA could order an immediate halt to operations, but I doubt they could then appropriate the land to sort the problem out. It looks like for that, they'd need a prosecution: a long time: 7.4.5 https://t.co/N2YfZThtfm

Unfortunately I don't think #WalleysQuarry will be shut down. I suspect pressure from central government is being applied to keep it open. That would explain why @EnvAgencyMids have completely abandoned their role as regulator and taken on the role of facilitator.

#StopTheStink

The @EnvAgencyMids have milestones for @RedIndustries2 but @ClareDinnisEA has given no ‚Äòdelivery‚Äô date‚Äô to mitigate the odourü§∑No root cause found plus the unexpected behaviour of the toxic gas, means let try a few things & keep our ü§ûIs this a joke? It‚Äôs not a plan #stopthestink

tweets.text: @JuliaBradbury @RedIndustries2 @EnvAgency @MattHancock @guardian @Independent Reallly, thank you Julia. Your support means a lot. @StinkStopthe

@EnvAgencyMids Immediate üòÇüòÇüòÇ you crack me up @EnvAgency !!! how is 4 months immediate for a start . 5 breaches are 5 breaches , thats 10 in total . The recent 5 show @RedIndustries2 ARE NOT COMPETENT OPERATORS surely ?

@scottdegg @EnvAgencyMids @RedIndustries2 @ClareDinnisEA It certainly feels this way.  I‚Äôve been researching technological solutions to be able to breathe in my own home, because I don‚Äôt trust the @EnvAgency to do what they are supposed to. Please message me if you want to know more. I‚Äôm going to talk about my findings tmrw

@EnvAgencySE @thameswater @EnvAgency @JamesBevanEA @EmmaHowardBoyd @MariaHerlihyEA @DeTom48 @chunkiesgreat It‚Äôs great that @thameswater has been punished for this appalling vandalism. It underlines that we don‚Äôt need a raft of new laws. @DefraGovUK need to give @EnvAgency enough cash to properly enforce the existing rules. Government by announcement doesn‚Äôt stop pollution.

The @EnvAgency have become a useless toothless organisation.Plenty more pollution issues in the Uk going unresolved as EA won‚Äôt act.
This one is something different though, why normalise health harms? It makes no sense #stopthestink https://t.co/NrA0uTgEwa

... and here is our news release telling the whole story... of failures at a @thameswater sewage treatment plant... missed alarms... the catastrophic #pollution that followed... and the ¬£4m fine... 
#NewMalden 2/2
